title.native: 終末トレインどこへいく？
title.english: Train to the End of the World

description:
In a seemingly ordinary rural town, something strange is happening to the residents. But Shizuru Chikura is more concerned for her missing friend. Determined to find her, Shizuru and three other girls board an abandoned train and travel to the outside world, unsure if they’ll make it back alive. As they venture toward the unknown, the question looms: What awaits them at the final stop?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Where Does the Doomsday Train Go?

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Shogi
tags.description: Centers around the game of shogi.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

title.native: わんわんトレインどこへいく？

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/118512/) or [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/218342/) by the same name._
Composite artist affiliated with T2 Studio.
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
__Fumihiko Suganuma__ is a Japanese animator, episode director, storyboard artist and prop designer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rokudenashi_nzn) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@Rokudenashi_ninzin) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rokudenashi_ninzin/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@rokudenashi_ninzin)

Rokudenashi (ロクデナシ) is a music project centered around vocalist Ninzin, and featuring a variety of Vocaloid producers who produce her songs.
